formula: If we define f(m,j,x) = sum(binomial(m,k)*stirling2(k,j)*x^(m-k),k=j..m) then a(n-3) = f(n,3,6), (n >= 3). [_Milan Janjic_, Apr 26 2009]a(n) = 17*a(n-1) - 72*a(n-2) + 7^(n+1) - 6^(n+1), a(0)=1, a(1)=30. - Vincenzo Librandi, Mar 11 2011a(n) = (9^(n+3) - 3*8^(n+3) + 3*7^(n+3) - 6^(n+3))/6. [_Yahia Kahloune_, Jun 12 2013]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
